I've known about the Brazilian Wandering spider for a while, they go into houses down there and they're BIG! Being in the medical field, of course I know about priapism, but that spider across that guys face did it for me! I'm afraid of the Amazon Basin anyway due to those giant anacondas, hoards of mosquitoes, which I detest and other scary animals down there like big Jaguars, electric eels and piranhas, bullet ants, foot-long biting centipedes, etc.! But spiders and snakes -- uh uh, no Amazon no way!
Then there's the Australian Funnel-Web spider! I'll take our common Black Widow spider any day of the week over those other two! I've seen those in eaves and in and around woodpiles all my life. Then, I got bit by a BW spider on my foot, and I was concerned because my physician father had a patient die from a Black Widow Spider bite. The man had a bad allergic reaction. He worked in a dairy and the spider was in his dairy boot, he put his boot on, got bit, felt it, shook the "shiny black spider" out of his boot and thought nothing of it. But he got terrible belly cramps, sicker, and by the time he got to the hospital, his abdomen was as hard as a board and his back curved out, my Dad said. Doctors tried everything but it was too late. But I knew to treat my bite and watch it, it got red and swelled a bit, I iced it and elevated it and in a few hours it was almost normal again. Of course, the black widow may not have injected much venom, nonetheless, I was a bit concerned. Now, I am sure I won't visit the Amazon, too many snakes, spiders and I don't know what else deadly animal exists there! Guess it's a good thing I did my world traveling before I knew about some of these things! There's a couple of other spiders like the Brown Recluse (mostly South Central U.S.)and the Yellow Sac (mostly NorthEastern U.S. but they could be in any State) that are venomous, but I have never even SEEN either the Brown Recluse or the Yellow Sac spiders, not in the NorthWest U.S.A. where I live! I'm not really afraid of spiders, but I just don't want them ON me, and I sure don't want to get bit by one!
I spent almost 45 minutes once, bent over watching a common orb spider spin her web from beginning to end, in a bush in my front yard. it was fascinating. But watching from a foot away is a lot different than finding one on you; once one fell down from the ceiling on my bed once landing on my arm -- I almost had heart failure! Now, I'm always checking the ceiling! I live in the country and they can get in through the smallest places, in spite of screens, etc... I keep an eye out for spiderwebs in my house all the time. BUT, without spiders in our world, we would be over-run with insects so they're important, but why do we have to have deadly ones?! Same reason we have snakes, I guess, so we won't be over-run with rodents! Most dangerous animals leave you alone if you leave them alone! It's just part of life (or death!).

I am a Psychiatrist and some of the anti depressants do cause priapism. I am retired now but one of the reasons I have never been sued is because I discussed with my patients many of the side effects. I took time to give risks.
So if your physician is so pushed for time (TY US Congress because they set up the American Medical Association who sets the time codes) BEFORE one takes any medications, ask the pharmacist WHAT ARE THE SIDE EFFECTS? ASK about the non medical ingredients too. Some people may not tolerate some of the non medical ingredients in a capsule or pill. Most people know their body BETTER that the physician. Without time, the physician cannot get to know the person s/he is trying to make better. So be your own advocate.
Any licensed physician must by federal law tell the reader the medical information given does not make a doctor/patient relationship. Consider this a public service announcement.

hey Destin, I'd Like to share my story.
so, I have Sickle cell disease and have been battling with Priapism for upwards of 10 years,
I've finally gotten rid of it 2 and a 1/2 years ago after I've almost died from it and with the complications of SCD. In the Past I've done countless Cavernosal Drainings (with the needles ) which was like every other day for 7 years, a couple of shunts one under GA and one awake. 4x insertion and removal of a prosthesis which was supposed to stop the priapism but did no such thing. and kept rupturing the lining,



so All in all, I've suffered 10 years of 3hrs a day sleep while waking up with Priapism
and knowing that I will have it when I sleep will keep me from going to sleep until I cant stay awake anymore and collaps from the sleep deprived state,
unimaginable pain from both SCD and Priapism several hours a day
11 surgeries two of which under local anesthesia which I could feel the pain of cutting
countless needles stabbed in a nerve rich area
and complete impotence now.


so all I wanted to say is people might think the Priapism jokes are funny but bellive me no body wants to try it, I'd rather die than to have a Minuit of that ever again. or even the state of not having it but knowing when I succumb to sleep I will wake up to that pain.

The simple fact that the majority of your viewers will in all likelihood never encounter one of those spiders should be enough to not waste time on traveling to the rainforest and/or waste video time showing us the spider. Those few minutes could have been spent giving us more or better information on the topic. I find this to be a rather frequent occurrence in your videos. You will have a great topic or at least an interesting topic yet you waste time on some folly of one kind or another and not enough time on the actual topic. I live in Brazil. When I was a kid, we lived in a tent near the forest for a while (hippie parents, lol). There was an area near the "shower" where these spiders will consistently appear. Every single day, I had to check the area thoroughly. You don't want to be showering and suddenly there's one of these 20 cm (8") away from your face. Specially because they jump. Twice that distance. So I killed hundreds of these. With my hands. The "shower" was fenced with plastic sheet, so there wasn't really a way to hit them with a shoe or something. Spraying them wad out of the picture because a) if they survive they become aggressive (mad) and b) when you have to kill several spiders per day, it ends up getting pricey. So I started this thing of capturing them with my hand, and quickly crushing them in a one swift motion. They didn't have time to react. The only protection I would use was a plastic bag in my hand, just to keep the crushed spider's juices from my hand.
I look back at that now, all these years after, and specially knowing this now, I realise it was waaaaaaaaaay more dangerous than what I thought it was.

Very awesome video! So I would like to specify the meanings of the four words for love.
-Eros=Erotic Love (As you said, but in modern times we use Erotas.)
-Agape=Erotic/Friendly Love (Like love towards your family. You're showing agape towards your mother)
-Filia=Frienly Love and is also used as a second part of words that describe a special approach of someone towards something anormal (sexually). For example: Pedophilia (Being sexually approached to childern) or Zoophilia (Being sexually approached to animals) and so on.
-Storge=Not erotic Love. It's more like Agape, but only on the friendly love. Your mother shows storge when she hugs you for example.

Actually clitoral priapism also exists. The clitoris and the penis are homologous organs, meaning that they are the same organ but developed differently in males and females. Homologous organs develop from the same tissue in a fetus. When we are in the fetal stage we are all the same, it is the exposure to sex hormones during development that makes us develop into male or female or in some cases somewhere in between the two. Clitoral erections work the exact same way as penile erections so I would guess that this spider could potentially cause priapism in a female as well.

Nitrous Oxide (N2O) is what the dentist gives you. This is Nitric Oxide (NO) which can be found in Pre-Workout supplements (Hence NO-Xplode).

Taken from Wikipedia: Nitric oxide should not be confused with nitrous oxide (N2O), an anaesthetic and greenhouse gas, or with nitrogen dioxide (NO2), a brown toxic gas and a major air pollutant. However, nitric oxide is rapidly oxidised in air to nitrogen dioxide.

The circulatory system uses nitric oxide to relax blood vessels.  In humans, it would cause an increase in blood pressure.  In insects, it could cause fatal circulatory collapse.  That is the evolutionary benefit.  It is a quick way to kill its food, which in the rainforest is likely very large and relatively strong, and to damage or kill predators allowing it to escape.

Nitric Oxide is a free radical (extremely reactive chemical) used for vasoconstriction (constricting the muscles to cause erection, GI motility, air flow constriction, etc). What's really interesting is the fact that free radicals cause havoc in the cell, binding to random molecules (proteins, DNA, etc). The body generally avoids free radicals by creating antioxidants. The fact the body used this as a signal AND a spider surpasses the bodies free radical defense is AMAZING. SCIENCE
